meanings.definition: A diagram representing social relationships within a group.
meanings.sent1: In class, we drew a sociogram to show who we talk to the most.
meanings.sent2: The sociogram displayed how students interacted with each other during the project.
meanings.sent3: The sociogram looked like a map of friendship paths in our class.
meanings.sent4: The sociogram was like a spider web, connecting everyone in the group.
meanings.sent5: The sociogram made it easy to see who was friends with whom.

meanings.definition: A tool used to analyze social interactions and relationships.
meanings.sent1: The sociogram helped us understand how people communicate in our team.
meanings.sent2: Researchers often use a sociogram to study social dynamics.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally used the sociogram as a coaster for my drink.
meanings.sent4: The sociogram was like a magnifying glass for our social connections.
meanings.sent5: Using the sociogram, we could see patterns in our social network.

meanings.definition: A visual representation of social connections and interactions.
meanings.sent1: The colorful sociogram on the wall showed who was friends with whom.
meanings.sent2: The teacher used a sociogram to explain the social structure of the class.
meanings.sent3: I pretended the sociogram was a treasure map leading to friendship gold.
meanings.sent4: The sociogram was a snapshot of our social web frozen in time.
meanings.sent5: The sociogram made our social network look like a beautiful mosaic.
